body_html:
But my question is "how often does tensorflow get this empty string?". As in, is there some end-to-end scenario where you see a difference?
…
On Mon, Apr 23, 2018 at 11:07 AM Sergey Abbakumov ***@***.***> wrote: The cost of a single function call is small anyway. But here we do not require heap allocation and the pointer indirection. I have a benchmark where the new version of getting the empty string is 15% faster than the old one. — You are receiving this because your review was requested. body_text:
But my question is "how often does tensorflow get this empty string?". As
in, is there some end-to-end scenario where you see a difference?
…
On Mon, Apr 23, 2018 at 11:07 AM Sergey Abbakumov ***@***.***> wrote:
 The cost of a single function call is small anyway. But here we do not
 require heap allocation and the pointer indirection. I have a benchmark
 where the new version of getting the empty string is 15% faster than the
 old one.

body:
But my question is "how often does tensorflow get this empty string?". As
in, is there some end-to-end scenario where you see a difference?

On Mon, Apr 23, 2018 at 11:07 AM Sergey Abbakumov <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> The cost of a single function call is small anyway. But here we do not
> require heap allocation and the pointer indirection. I have a benchmark
> where the new version of getting the empty string is 15% faster than the
> old one.
